alert.note: Alert for Orange County Coastal; San Diego County Coastal Areas (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: High Surf Advisory issued January 09 at 9:33PM PST until January 11 at 6:00PM PST by NWS SanDiego
info.description: ...HIGH SURF ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 8 PM WEDNESDAY TO 6 PM PST THURSDAY... ...COASTAL FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 4 AM TO NOON PST THURSDAY... * WHAT...For the High Surf Advisory, large breaking waves of 5 to 7 feet, with occasional sets 8 to 11 feet. Highest surf in southern San Diego County. For the Coastal Flood Advisory, minor coastal flooding expected. * WHERE...Beaches of San Diego County and Orange County. * WHEN...For the High Surf Advisory, from 8 PM Wednesday to 6 PM PST Thursday. For the Coastal Flood Advisory, from 4 AM to noon PST Thursday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of low-lying beach parking lots, boardwalks, and roads with isolated road closures possible. Dangerous swimming and surfing conditions and localized beach erosion. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...High tide of around 6.7 feet is predicted Thursday morning at around 810 AM PST.
info.instruction: If travel is required, allow extra time as some roads may be closed. Do not drive around barricades or through water of unknown depth. Take the necessary actions to protect flood-prone property. Inexperienced swimmers should remain out of the water due to dangerous surf conditions.

area.areaDesc: Orange County Coastal; San Diego County Coastal Areas
